required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Whey Protein Supplementation and Resistance Exercise on Muscle Parameters in Older Adults
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of Whey Protein Supplementation on Resistance Exercise-Induced Changes in Muscle Strength, Fat Free Mass, and Function in Mobility-Limited Older Adults

brief_summary.textblock: This research study is looking at the effects of a whey protein nutritional supplement on changes in muscle mass, strength and physical function in response to a 6 month program of strength training exercise.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, mid-study and end of study

intervention.description: powdered, 46g supplement dissolved in fluids, twice daily
powdered, 46g supplement dissolved in fluids, twice daily

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male and Females 70-85 yrs
- Community dwelling
- Short Physical Performance Battery score < 10
- BMI = 21-32.5
Exclusion Criteria:
- Acute or terminal illness
- Mini Mental State Exam < 23
- Myocardial infarction in previous 6 months, symptomatic coronary artery disease, or congestive heart failure
- Upper or lower extremity fracture in previous 6 months
- Uncontrolled hypertension (>150/90 mm Hg).
- Neuromuscular diseases and drugs which affect neuromuscular function.
- Hormone replacement therapy
- eGFR <30 mL/min/1.73m2
- Types I and II Diabetes Mellitus
- Dietary protein intake < 0.8 g.kg-1.day-1
- Disorders of nutrient absorption
- Milk, or whey allergy
- Sulfa drugs and allergy to PABA-containing sunscreens

overall_official.affiliation: Jean Mayer USDA Human Nutrition Research Center on Aging

facility.name: Jean Mayer USDA Human Nutrition Research Center on Aging

responsible_party.investigator_title: Director and Senior Scientist, Professor of Nutrition, Jean Mayer USDA Human Nutrition Research Center on Aging.
